skin_diseases.name: Acne
skin_diseases.overview: Acne is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells. It often causes whiteheads, blackheads or pimples, and usually appears on the face, forehead, chest, upper back and shoulders.
causes: Hair follicles clogged by oil and dead skin cells

skin_diseases.name: Actinic Keratosis
skin_diseases.overview: Actinic keratoses are rough, scaly patches on the skin that develop from years of sun exposure. They're most commonly found on areas exposed to the sun, such as the face, lips, ears, forearms, and hands.
symptoms: Rough, dry or scaly patch of skin
Color varies from pink to red to brown

skin_diseases.name: Benign Tumors
skin_diseases.overview: Benign skin tumors are non-cancerous growths on the skin. They can appear as moles, skin tags, lipomas, or other types of growths that don't spread to other parts of the body.

skin_diseases.name: Bullous
skin_diseases.overview: Bullous diseases are characterized by the formation of blisters (bullae) on the skin and mucous membranes. These can be caused by autoimmune conditions, infections, or other factors.

skin_diseases.name: Candidiasis
skin_diseases.overview: Candidiasis is a fungal infection caused by Candida yeast. It commonly affects warm, moist areas of the body such as the mouth, throat, esophagus, and genital area.

skin_diseases.name: Drug Eruption
skin_diseases.overview: Drug eruptions are adverse skin reactions caused by medications. They can range from mild rashes to severe, life-threatening conditions like Stevens-Johnson syndrome.

skin_diseases.name: Eczema
skin_diseases.overview: Eczema, also known as atopic dermatitis, is a condition that makes skin red and itchy. It's common in children but can occur at any age. It's a chronic condition that tends to flare periodically.

skin_diseases.name: Infestations and Bites
skin_diseases.overview: Skin infestations and bites can be caused by various parasites, insects, or arthropods. Common examples include scabies, lice, bed bugs, and mosquito bites.

skin_diseases.name: Lichen
skin_diseases.overview: Lichen planus is an inflammatory condition that can affect the skin, hair, nails, and mucous membranes. It appears as purplish, itchy, flat-topped bumps on the skin.

skin_diseases.name: Lupus
skin_diseases.overview: Lupus is an autoimmune disease where the body's immune system attacks its own tissues and organs. Skin manifestations are common and can include butterfly rash, discoid lesions, and photosensitivity.

skin_diseases.name: Moles
skin_diseases.overview: Moles are common skin growths made up of cells that produce pigment (melanocytes). Most moles are harmless, but some can develop into melanoma, a type of skin cancer.

skin_diseases.name: Psoriasis
skin_diseases.overview: Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune condition that causes rapid skin cell production, resulting in thick, silvery scales and itchy, dry, red patches that are sometimes painful.

skin_diseases.name: Rosacea
skin_diseases.overview: Rosacea is a common skin condition that causes redness and visible blood vessels in the face. It may also produce small, red, pus-filled bumps.

skin_diseases.name: Seborrheic Keratoses
skin_diseases.overview: Seborrheic keratoses are noncancerous skin growths that appear as waxy, scaly, slightly raised patches. They're very common in people over 50 and can appear anywhere on the body.

skin_diseases.name: Skin Cancer
skin_diseases.overview: Skin cancer is the abnormal growth of skin cells, most often on skin exposed to the sun. The three main types are basal cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, and melanoma.

skin_diseases.name: Sun/Sunlight Damage
skin_diseases.overview: Sun damage refers to skin damage caused by ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun. This can include sunburn, premature aging, and increased risk of skin cancer.

skin_diseases.name: Tinea
skin_diseases.overview: Tinea is a fungal infection of the skin, also known as ringworm. It can affect various parts of the body including the scalp, body, feet (athlete's foot), and groin (jock itch).

skin_diseases.name: Unknown/Normal
skin_diseases.overview: This category represents either normal skin or skin conditions that cannot be clearly identified or classified into specific disease categories.

skin_diseases.name: Vascular Tumors
skin_diseases.overview: Vascular tumors are growths composed of blood vessels. They can be benign (like hemangiomas) or malignant. Most are present at birth or appear in early childhood.

skin_diseases.name: Vasculitis
skin_diseases.overview: Vasculitis is inflammation of blood vessels that can affect vessels of any size. When it affects the skin, it can cause various rashes, ulcers, and other skin changes.

skin_diseases.name: Vitiligo
skin_diseases.overview: Vitiligo is a condition in which patches of skin lose their pigmentation due to the destruction of melanocytes (pigment-producing cells). It can affect any part of the body.

skin_diseases.name: Warts
skin_diseases.overview: Warts are small, fleshy bumps on the skin caused by human papillomavirus (HPV). They can appear anywhere on the body and are contagious through direct contact.
